Reviews.Title: “Excellent and fun with delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chinagirlrocco
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Wanderlust. It was a thoughtfully designed hotel with an excellent restaurant. Each floor is designed by a different group of designers and the feel was extremely trendy. We stayed in the whimsical loft room, which was designed a bit like a tree house in a forest. There is a nespresso machine and very nice toiletries. The only reason why I do not award it full points is because trendiness slightly prioritises practicality. For example, there is absolutely nowhere to hang your wet towel after a shower, and there is hardly any space around the sink to stand a pot of cream. The air conditioner worked well, but I personally don't like being in a room where there is no option to open the window even a crack. It just feels a bit claustrophobic to me. This really is a a great place to stay and I would certainly go back. The staff were unfailingly helpful and the location, while perhaps not to everyone's taste, really suited me. Stay, but for a few days not an extended period, by then the lack of surfaces and airlessness might start to be annoying. But an extremely nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting area, but only for 1-3 days”
Reviews.Author: Vicki W
Reviews.Content: The room was uncomfortable, no room to sit down. Hard for older couple to climb into bed. On the edge of Little India which was a unique experience. For the adventurous.

Reviews.Title: “Funky new boutique hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Catherine B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Wanderlust based on its TripAdvisor reviews. We were not steered wrong - this is a great hotel. It is right in Little India. It was built in 2010 so everything is very new. The rooms are tiny but from what I understand, that is standard for Singapore. They provide Kiehl's toiletries and even an Iphone dock. The breakfast is included and is fantastic. My only gripe is that our room (207) was right over a cafe that is open until 3 am, and it was pretty loud. When I asked to be switched, the front desk said that they didn't have any other "rooms of our type" available. It might have been lost in translation, but in the US, a hotel would normally switch you to any available room if you are having noise problems, not just another room of the same type. Luckily we brought a travel white noise maker with us so it drowned out the cafe sound. Otherwise we really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An Exprience Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the space themed rooms months in advance, it was all ready for us when we arrived at an ungodly hour although check in took a bit longer than anyone would like. The bed is amazingly comfortable although the the "stairs" up to it are so steep you may as well call it a ladder. Wifi passwords are uniform and limited to one user at a time per room so if your wifi isn't working just try another room's, it's what the person using yours has done.

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: beanie_nz
Reviews.Content: First time to Singapore and we wanted to stay somewhere off the beaten track. The staff were really helpful and we liked the downstairs bar (fantastic cider!). We stayed in a concept room on the 4th floor the tree hut style. It was pretty cool but still felt small and not alot of space to store our luggage or unpack. My husband struggled with the shower but soon figured it out! We both though the room could have used more light. We didnt use the MRT so we could maximise our time but we found the station which was only 5min walk away. Little India is a bustling old school area of Sinagpore and a great soure of cheap amazing food. Orchard road is a 10min taxi ride away and getting around was easy. Singapore really is Asia 101 and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with style, great service”
Reviews.Author: drewsmithbco
Reviews.Content: Quirky boutique hotel with stylish but small rooms. Ours had the toilet enclosed in a frosted glass stall, which may not be enough privacy for some. The breakfast was just ok Euro/American style, but a welcome break from noodles. Staff was very helpful in arranging logistics, and even packed a breakfast for us for our 6AM departure. For some reason, cabdrivers do not know this hotel, you'll need to have the address handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a staycation”
Reviews.Author: StephanieSS
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of the run-of-the-mill type hotels, Wanderlust located at Little India is a great place to start with. Firstly, it's located in cultural little India - take a stroll and take in the lights and colours of Little India, have dinner at one of the many Indian restaurants or if you up for a walk - to the 24 hours Mustafa shopping center. we stayed over 1 night for a staycation and I really did like the place. We chose one of the Loft rooms. the lower level of the room was huge and it's an open concept with no segregation of the toilet and the rest of the room. One suggestion though would be to move the TV so that we can have a better view while relaxing in the tub. the toiletries provided were from Kiehl's so that's even more of a plus. The upstairs area was much smaller - just a queen size bed and a much smaller tv but nonetheless a cosy area for a weekend away from the city. One grip I had - the room we had (some starry themed one) was a lil too dark for my liking and had to be extra careful climbing up and down the stairs. I will be back but the next time, I would definitely try the rooms with other themes.

Reviews.Title: “Unique but strange place. Worth to stay for 1 or 2 days.”
Reviews.Author: AustinYe
Reviews.Content: The total decoration might be strange for some people, old tradition people. There are no desk at the room since it is very small. So it is not for business traveler. But as it name implies, it is build for wanderlust people. I like it for: 1. Good breakfast though some choice is not good and milk is not very fresh which make me fart. I never had this problem at Hilton though their price is different. 2. Big brand bath supplies: Kiehl's. This is better than those customization shampoos.. 3. Nespresso. You did not get it wrong, it is Nespresso, not some instant coffee. 4. Complimentary mini bar drinks, though only coke and orange/apple juice available. Still very good. 5. Enough fresh air supplies. Most aircon room dont have enough fresh air supplies from outside since heat/cool the air costs more power. The recycled air could make people uncomfortable, for example, do not sleep well. I dont like: 1. too small room, then no desk no storage place..... 2. Outside hotel is a little messy. 3. Jacuzzi place is closed at 9:00pm and not allow to sit there even you dont want get into the water. It is a little bad since this place is the only open area you could laid down and look at the sky. Overall, the price is a little high, but as a special experience, worth to stay 1 or 2 days. Not recommend for long time for the small room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice but rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Giuliana1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is great, nice to have a drink at night. Breakfast was great- everything was very fresh. Staff is friendly and helpful however, the rooms are far too small. It's fine if you are looking for something different for a night, but not for longer.

Reviews.Title: “It was an OK stay”
Reviews.Author: DK-NO
Reviews.Content: I guess our stay was OK. The receptionist was friendly and helpful - although we arrived quite late (around 9pm). We got the red room, which could be very blinding at first - to get used to the red light. The noise outside was loud, but it wasn't the hotel's fault. This hotel is located in Little India, which is within walk-distance from Bugis MRT (closer to Little India) from the airport, but it was rather confusing to find due to the constructions around the area (some paths were blocked / closed). What disappoints me the most is probably the fact that they provide only wifi for one device, luckily it was easy to overcome this problem. I mean, nowadays people have two or more devices, especially if there are two people staying - I don't see the problem of giving more people internet access when Singapore is supposed to be "high-tech" and all. I wish I could say that our stay was great, but it was OK, nothing more nothing less. I would probably pick another hotel next time I stay in SIngapore, though

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, very small rooms.”
Reviews.Content: The location is not great, pretty noisy on a side street in Little India. It is ultamodern hotel, not inexpensive, with ultra small rooms. Not bad, but we wished we had stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Staycation.”
Reviews.Author: Landy L
Reviews.Content: Booked the Whimsical "Bling" Loft for a weekend staycation with my girlfriend. We loved the artfully decorated loft which proved to be a different touch compared to the usual hotel decorations. Plus the Kiehl's toiletries, Nespresso, free minibar and daily breakfast were appreciated. Overall, we've enjoyed our time at Wanderlust and will be back to try out their other loft themes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable chic in a down-to-earth part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: bennythebulb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights on a business/tourist visit. Fun and funky and very comfortable. Just down the road from some great Indian restaurants, and about a 10 minute walk from nearest MRT station. Very close to electronics mall. Great breakfast choice, and our room was very peaceful, with only window looking into internal chute that's open to the sky.

Reviews.Title: “The restaurant Cocotte is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Guntsche
Reviews.Content: My wife and me meet some friends in Singapore at the restaurant Cocotte on first floor of the hotel. I can not comment on the hotel itself, but the restaurant is very good. The restaurant is alternative and fits perfectly into the concept of the hotel. And so do the dishes. They are simple but innovative and taste jammy. They also have a nice variety of good vines. We where there on a Wednesday night and is was full. So I recommend making a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully themed rooms, friendly service & a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: TraveLoverSGP
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had our pre-wedding photoshoot at Wanderlust and we also stayed in the Whimsical Loft (Typewriter-themed) for 1 night. We chose this boutique hotel because of its unique theme that stands out from other boutique hotels in Singapore. We had pre-arranged an early check-in with the Marcom Mgr for our photoshoot and she was extremely accommodating to our request. Upon arrival at the hotel, check-in was pretty swift and the reception staff were very friendly. The Marcom Mgr even came to our room to greet us to ensure that everything is attended to. The lift to the rooms is located just beside the reception counter. You need to scan your room key (access card) in order to operate the lift - an appreciated security measure by the hotel. The Whimsical Lofts are on the highest level (level 4) of the building, the other rooms are located on levels 2 & 3. You will be pleased to know that WIFI, drinks, tea and Nespresso are complimentary. A staff also brought up a complimentary bottle of wine for us. The loft is also equipped with 2 TVs (lower & upper level), 2 phones (lower & upper level), an electric kettle, an iPod dock and a safe. The loft has a bathtub, rain shower and 2 wash basins. The hotel also provides shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion from Kiehl's. You need to climb the stairs to get to the king-sized bed and the steps are quite small so be careful. Next to the bed, you will find a lamp and dimmer switch for the lights in the room. The thing that got to me was the rather poor sound-proofing of the rooms. We could hear people talking and doors closing along the corridor which can be quite irritating in the night. You must try the food at Cocotte - the hotel's restaurant. Do make reservations because it is very popular. I would recommend their Basque Squid (a spicy squid stew) and their Roast Pork Collar - really awesome stuff! We had complimentary breakfast the next morning which was pretty good as well. There is also a buffet table filled with bread and a variety of cereal. Upon checking-out, the reception staff asked if we still wanted the complimentary bottle of wine which was very thoughtful. If you drive, public car park lots are rather limited at the front of the hotel. You may have to park your vehicle about 100 metres away from the hotel if you cannot find a lot in front of the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay plus the service and food are top notch!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of great nights here over Chinese New Year 2012. The rooms were amazing and the staff was very nice. We stayed in the princess room on 3rd floor, which had a great bed, free wifi and mini-bar, and a Nespresso machine. The staff very kindly gave us a tour of some of the one-of-a-kind rooms on the 4th floor. Sadly, the restaurant was closed on the nights we were there, but breakfast was awesome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, modern hotel with nice touches”
Reviews.Author: Zeenz
Reviews.Content: A great, unique hotel in a convenient location in Singapore. The standard rooms are on the smallish side but unique touches such as nespresso machines and I-pod docks are great. The breakfast was definitely a highlight with a great choice of fresh fruits, juices and continental bits and your choice of freshly cooked hot breakfast - delicious! You also get a guide with suggestions of things to do in Singapore and the reception can recommend any extras - e.g. they suggested a great place for late dinner. Reception can also lend you an ipad - very helpful for checking into your flights etc. Overall, Wanderlust is a nice alternative to large hotel chains!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and very cute design!”
Reviews.Author: Armani74
Reviews.Content: This was a great find! an amazing hotel offering great value and service in a convenient location. I loved the free breakfast, free Wifi, complimentary drinks in the minibar and the free local calls. The staff was always very nice and friendly and the rooms are all unique!! We got the typewriter room :-) a gorgeous loft style room and I have to say the bathroom setup is very nice! The Kiehls amenities were the icing on the cake....! Breakfast offering was for a full breakfast, choice of hot items made to order; the buffet included fruit, cereal and breads; all good quality! Loved being near Little India and going to Tekka market! TIP, try the biryani !!! there is a vendor who has to HUGE pots one with biryani and one with chicken, TRY IT!......! Found a HUGE supermarket called Mustafa's who had everything possible under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix2Sydney
Reviews.Content: Singapore is an expensive city for hotels. Wanderlust offered a special deal on their own website (not evident on booking engines) which was good value at US$130 per night with breakfast. The hotel is in a redeveloped schoolhouse in Little India and is 'boutique designer' with each of the three floors designed by a different local company. The smallest rooms are on the Pantone floor so each is a different color - and I don't mean just feature walls. It's everything. Which is calming if you have Cyan as I did but maybe Yellow would be a bit too much... Everything is well thought out. The rooms are described as 'capsule' which is perhaps unfair given the reasonable dimensions and ensuites. But it's tru in terms of the absence of any work desk or usable surface, the platform bed, and the presence of gadgets such as Nespresso, iPod player, flat screen, and rainshower. All in it's very workable, with free good wifi, a comprehensive breakfast, and reasonable soundproofing, though they do give you earplugs to combat late-night revelers in the streets below. Location is great as long as you don't mind a very sanitised version of India at your door. Service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ive been to”
Reviews.Author: charlord
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during June 2011 and it was incredible. To start - the location is great. It is right in the centre of little india, approx 10 minute walk from the subway which will connect you anywhere you want to go. However, we actually walked to clarke quay, the parks and raffles on our stay there - it took around 20 mins to reach raffles (if that) and meant we got to see singapore in the evening. Little India is also really interesting and worth looking around - we had a great thali one afternoon there. But...the hotel....it was phenomonal. We stayed in the 'Typewriter Room'...it was absolutely stunning!! Free minibar, nespresso machiine, 2 flat screen tv's, one of which was on the mezzanine with one of the most comfy beds i have ever slept in, gorgeous bath and separate shower. The toiletries were khiels and were amazing, the towels and dressing gowns were incredibly soft. I didnt want to leave!!!! Breakfast was also fantastic - there is a help yourself buffet with 'do-it-yourself' muesli, pastries and juices and a selection of bread for toast (with plentiful toppings). You also got a cooked breakfast - I had eggs and bacon - which was delicious. On top of this, the staff were incredibly helpful. They gave us a notebook with recommended restaurants, were attentive to needs and just incredibly relaxed and helpful. I cannot recommend this place enough - it is worth every penny. Unfortunately it has now set the bar so high that I am not sure any hotel has compared since!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Cute Cute”
Reviews.Author: Afralique
Reviews.Content: Wanderlust is in a fantastic location, a ten dollar taxi ride to pretty much anywhere and all of little india at your doorstep to explore. The room was large, clean and decorated with some strange doll houseesque cut outs on the wall with soft recessed lighting and a huge tv, let down slightly by the two beds pushed together pretending to be a king, (which had a habit of pulling apart in the night with some hilarious results) although saying this it was still very comfortable. We stayed on the mono floor and the room came with complimentary drinks fridge and nespresso machine. breakfast was served in the french themed restaurant downstairs and while not a huge selection the food was tasty and on the morning we slept through breakfast the lovely staff still arranged for us, coffee, cereal, orange juice and yoghurt at no charge. Over all the staff were very friendly and were always looking to accomodate any request we had and make our stay perfect, which it pretty much was. In fact the only negative thought I had the whole time we were there was that the milk pods given for the coffee were too small. We will be looking for Wanderlust hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer more facilities for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: IlliterateFoodCritic
Reviews.Content: Wife: we live in east London in Hackney near our equivalent version of "little India" and their sister hotel "the town hall" is up the road from our house.  Funky up and coming areas are comfortable to us. But there is still a realistic warning it's opposite a hotel that rents rooms by "the hour" and a pretty dirty area you find the wanderlust. The reason I tell you this is it's important you know that the hotel has invested in an area that is truly up and coming before it is truly up and coming.  I will add that Singapore crime rate is one of the lowest in the world so we do still feel happy to walk home at 12:00pm here. It's very impressive and beautifully architecturally designed. Every floor and room with a unique edge.  If like me you often fall in love with a hotel and forget the warnings Until you arrive and think of the practicalities (as far as the whimsical loft room goes) there is no wardrobe or draws, there are around 6 hangers on a rail. So the room is cool funky etc but your stuff will be laid out all over the place.  the breakfast was a small but excellent choice everything fresh and executed well, with "make your own musli bar"  Then a choice of eggs, pancakes with bacon or maple syrup, bannana and home made granola, or home made blueberrie and cream, homemade waffles, or a fruit bowl with fresh fruit and berries which we'd deeply missed since travelling asia for 5 weeks. Baked egg perfectly cooked. Best dressing gowns like putting on a comfy blanket.  Comfy beds, Over all for people who like quirky hotels this one is really good and immaculately clean.  I really like nespresso coffee so a real treat to have the machine in the room.  I loved the welcome notebook to take around and make notes in and things to do see and eat. Very inspiring.  We walked everywhere from here. To marina bay, to Orchard road, China town, botanical gardens. Holland road, And when your "shopped out" a taxi from anywhere cost us 8/10 dollars to get back.  there is also a Bus 7 straight to orchard road if your not a walker. Husband: As I don't drink caffeine it was a bit frustrating they Charged 6 dollars for a peppermint tea at breakfast.  Loved the shower pressure, Kiel products really good, funky hotel, clean, good bed. Prefer more facilities in a city hotel than wanderlust can offer, although Enjoyed a good curry in little India with a pitcher of beer for 40SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfortable, friendly staff will make you feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Stepanecek
Reviews.Content: Great and chic place to stay while in Singapore. Friendly staff at the reception will only help to make you feel like at home. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Little India”
Reviews.Author: summairu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Loved the location. I was definitely craving some great south indian food and local cuisine, so the location was perfect. The MRT is about 10 min walk. But other option is take the bus. We found buses to be more convenient than MRT. Wanderlust has live music at the restaurant on ground floor. The breakfast is decent. Not exotic but you have plenty to choose from. The mini bar is complimentary. If you love coffee, they have a nespresso machine in the rooms. Excellent service from the front desk to the restaurant to housekeeping, everyone was great. Few things that did could have been better are - Our room didn't have enough shelf space/desk to scatter around our things....Plus the window was right in front of another room.. So if you open the curtains, you are literally looking in someone room/bed and vice versa. But again all there rooms are different so if you get a good price for the hotel, then it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “stunning”
Reviews.Author: Ruffiole
Reviews.Content: stunning stunning stunning ! the staff was so polite and friendly ... the room *pop up* awesome !

Reviews.Title: “Inspiring hotel, cute design!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal H
Reviews.Content: Check-in at 2am...Service with a smile. Felt very welcome. Thanks. Loved the funny scrap book with the area info. Hotel is in the heart of Little India. Many veg' restaurants, great Indian atmosphere especially on Sunday. 7 mins walk to MRT Little India. The hotel is near Sim Lim electronics. Rooms are spacious enough, all necessary bathroom amenities. '(N)Espresso' Machine in the room is wonderful. Free minibar (non-alcohol) was a nice surprise. Would like some more lights in toilet and near the mirror...as you have to keep the curtains closed if you want some privacy... And a 'writing pad' to put on the tiled table(t) as this hotel is very inspiring for the traveler! and a 'luggage table or rack' would be nice. Loved the overal design. Would definitely recommend the hotel to women travelers (very serviceable staff) and even gay people will love this hotel as it is different and has some great design items.

Reviews.Title: “quirkiness itself”
Reviews.Author: teobesta
Reviews.Content: i absolutely adored wanderlust the information on the agoda website was misleading (nothing surprising there) but despite that i didn't find exactly what i was promised i still thoroughly loved my stay in the blue room (for which i'd asked) the service really was impeccable and they were quick to address the little problems in the room (the nespresso machine wasn't working, the lightbulb needed replacing) if i were to complain about anything, it's that the central air-conditioning was way too cold for me but turning it off meant that it didn't muffle the sound of the going and coming of the cleaning crew just across the hall from me (i had asked for a quiet room /-:), the voices of other guests inside (!) their rooms and the doors that closed rather noisily the aesthetic of the whole place was like a visual feast, including the Jacuzzi on the roof (despite the cold water) and the bathroom and toilet that made me feel like i was in a sci fi film honestly, i could have happily stayed there a few more nights it's true that the rooms are a bit overpriced but i'd still go back for the reasons above the perfect eggs at breakfast (i'm very picky about my eggs) and the most comfortable bed i'd ever slept in (and that is saying a lot)

Reviews.Title: “cramped rooms, limited breakfast options”
Reviews.Author: vin_cheulkar
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Singapore in the month of June for 5 nights. We had booked in advance through Xpedia.com. When we reached the hotel, they front desk staff asked for a deposit for SD100 for per night! we were shocked since we were not told anything about the deposit, if we were told we would never have booked in that hotel! Hell, not even 5 star hotels ask for deposit and this was a tiny place in a very runaway lane. We refused to pay the deposit explaining that we only had enough monies to do sightseeings! The room was as small as we expected. It was neat, however, the green colour was hurting the eyes. Our major disappointment was the breakfast. No variety at all for vegetarians. We had forgotten to ask whether they serve vegeterian breakfast. Even the cereals were non-veg. So the only thing we could have every day was bread and jam and bread and butter. No courtesy whatsoever in preparing atleast something vegetarian for their guests since we were there for 4 days! And on our last day when we entered the breakfast room at around 9.45, the breakfast was over for the day!!! what kind of hotel stops serving breakfast at 9.45!!! and there was no board anywhere stating the timings!! In all, we were totally disappointed with the service of the front desk staff and breakfast room staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Patone Room”
Reviews.Author: Ciaran M
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. The first was a well pro-portioned room on the 3rd floor. This stay was in a Patone room on the 2nd floor: To say the room is tiny in an understatement. It's a narrow corridor with a huge toilet and shower jutting into the space, no room to put suitcases on a raised surface and a bed on a raised platform at the end next to the windows. The colour was a garish turquoise. I checked in with some work to catch up on and as soon as I looked around the room, I realised there was no desk. I called reception and asked for a new room. I was put on hold as the receptionist contacted Sales staff, but was subsequently informed that none were available. The front desk staff were helpful and did locate a room at another hotel, but as this room was purchased through Agoda there was no option for refund without a lot of hassle and I opted to stay as I had to get on with the urgent work. I therefore had no option but to sit propped up on the bed with the laptop on a pillow. The noise of talking and laughter from the coffee shop next to the hotel went late into the night (the management acknowledge this and provide ear protectors). At 3 in the morning, and having slept badly, I went to 7-11 to get a snack and saw that one of the overnight hotel staff sitting in the coffee shop talking animatedly with another person. This can only encourage other people to hang around later into the night and should be discouraged. I have stayed at other hotels in the Unlisted Collection group such as New Majestic and 1929 and always found them to be very superior. But this stay was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Interestingly different and very good”
Reviews.Author: peter_miles
Reviews.Content: On business for my first visit to Singapore but since I am self-employed and hate impersonal 'business' hotels, Wanderlust was recommended to me as being within my price range, clean and comfortable. It was spot on. Having looked at a couple of reviews here beforehand, I requested in advance a quiet room, and got one (211) on the small internal courtyard. Not a drum was heard. The room was not enormous but quite enough for me on my own. If my wife had been with me we might have struggled a bit. (I was in one of the smaller rooms - I gather they have bigger ones.) The bed is in a sort of platform inside a couple of steps. To get into it you need to manoeuvre carefully but, once in, very comfortable. The (free) espresso machine and soft drinks in the mini bar were a great advantage as was (for me) the TV channel devoted to English footie. Breakfast was excellent - it is very rare to get a couple of freshly fried eggs on request. The tea came in a stewed pot keeping warm on the side, but you can't have everything. The best plan was to nip up to the room and bring down another espresso. I had one dinner in the restaurant: excellent but far from cheap. The position is good - given the price of the room. Bugis MRT station is as close as Little India station and more convenient for the airport and central business district. The staff were unfailingly polite, smiling and helpful. I am always impressed when they remember my name and use it. I hope to be back in Singapore soon and will certainly return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish place”
Reviews.Author: nigolasch
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Wanderlust for 2 nights and had a very enjoyalbe stay there. The room was very clean and the architecture is just great! it is located in Little India which might not be everybody's preference, but if you like a more lively neighbourhood, you will like this location. The breakfeast is absolutely great. Another pro was that we were able to access the room at noon already without paying extra. This was in deed great as we arrived with a very early flight in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Buzzing and Fun”
Reviews.Author: isobel b
Reviews.Content: Great vibe, great stay. Fantastic. But not for those seeking peace and quiet. We had a very cool time - and this is a great place to stay in a great city. Thanks to all

Reviews.Title: “Noisey!!”
Reviews.Author: crcwalsh
Reviews.Content: Cool place, great area, yet my room 203 backs onto an ally with a restaurant - very noisey! Past midnight and can't sleep due to sounds of drunk people yelling, etc. Staff gave me ear plugs as requested which should do the trick. Not advised for people who like quite.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: natasha m
Reviews.Content: Not only do the bellmen remember who you are from year to year, but if you have a convention at this hotel, you will receive the best service in the city. The expertise of the staff is unmeasureable, and they truly know how to anticipate your needs. With the new renovations, this hotel is definitely the best in the city and for a very affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty area. Noisy and smelly. Don't stay around little india.”
Reviews.Author: Praredaa
Reviews.Content: Horrible area. Terrible breakfast. Noisy and smelly

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights over the F 1 weekend, as I really liked the New Majestic hotel and Waterhouse on the bund (in Shanghai), both are part of the same hotel group and reincarnations of old buildings, sad to say I didn't enjoy Wanderlust though.   To start off with loved the location, my first time staying in Little India, an interesting and vibrant area in the city, the building and common areas are nicely reburbished, heard from friends the restaurant is quite good (I think it is rustic French, popular and two seatings a night), the lobby is refreshingly decorated, there is free wifi and breakfast, Kiehl shampoo etc The rooms though, ...we had two Pantone rooms both on the 2nd floor: 205 and 207, the rooms were small, long and narrow, so small I could not do even one sun salutation (ie stretch my arms), the rooms reminded me of college dorms, and just looked cheap. (unlike the much better designed New Majestic hotel). Water leaked from the shower ( both rooms ) and the shower is right next to the bed.   Worst yet on Sat 9 am there was drilling and construction outside the room, the other doors on our floor kept banging shut, room 207 also happened to be across the hallway from the housekeeper's room, where they must have kept the door opened at one point and I heard their extended conversation.   Not worth the S$300.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cortunefookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights recently, and would absolutely stay here again. The hotel is located in Little India, and it is only a short walk away from the MRT. It is about 10 minutes by taxi to Orchard Rd. We really enjoyed all the nearby Indian restaurants, and also walked over to Arab Street. The hotel itself is very cool, with funky interiors throughout. I had a mono room and it was large and well appointed. The bed was huge and very comfortable. I loved the Kiehl's bathroom products, the Nespresso machine, the free minibar, and the wifi. I had read other reviews that said that some rooms get noisy. I requested a more quiet room when I booked and had absolutely no problems with noise levels. Breakfast was good, but it is a little different to many hotels. The buffet was really just bread and muesli, but there was a menu with different options for eggs, pancakes, etc. and they were all great. The staff were all really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Singapore Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Coggers08
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel while searching for boutique hotels in Singapore and took a punt. It worked out to be a nice surprise. Right away the staff were friendly and welcoming, allowing us to check in very early (although we insisted we were happy to just leave our bags for a few hours and wander around). We took a small room because it was a short stay. The room was small and the separate cubicle idea for the shower and toilet was a strange concept. The toilet cubicle was closest to the bed so a little odd when you or your partner/travelling companion needs the facilities! Apart from that the room was pretty clean, great to have a Nespresso machine & nice tea selection. Being in Little India is a different experience to being central in town. But we enjoyed the visit and dinner at Banana Leaf Apollo a few streets away. I think we would stay again but would definitely look at a bigger room for sure. As the different floors have different designers I wouldn't think all rooms have cubicle shower/toilet set up. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and reception/bar/restaurant area. Thank you to all the staff who assisted us during the two days - you were fantastic! Hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky”
Reviews.Author: silv7r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very funky indeed. We stayed in one of the treehouse rooms and it was beautifully decorated. The Nespresso coffee and complimentary drinks was a big plus, along with the bath products too. Only downside was the steep stairs to the bed above (wouldn't recommend this room to those who are not able-bodied). The shower was unfortunately rather leaky in the sense that the water seeped out of the glass doors. Location-wise we weren't too bothered. It's a bit out of the way but it's in a nice area. Otherwise a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design hotel, good service, but the area is too vibrant”
Reviews.Author: Happy_namakemono
Reviews.Content: The design of the hotel, the restaurant, the service and breakfast are all good, which i shall not elaborate. The location is in little india, very vibrant, but during weekends and at night, it could be VERY noisy. My room was facing the restaurants with outdoor dining areas that open till after midnight. The noise was crazy, and luckily the hotel was also aware of the problem and provided in the room a pair of ear plug to block the noise, otherwise, i don't think i can sleep at all. There was some problem with the drainage of the shower room, after shower, the water could not drain away well. Mine was the yellow submarine room with a bath tub, which should be one of the larger room on the floor. The bed was comfortable (sorry to repeat again, the noise was really quite unbearable, luckily ear plugs were provided). Hotels in Singapore in general are getting more and more expensive. This hotel, probably due to its location, is relatively reasonably priced. I would consider this hotel again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Funky vs function”
Reviews.Author: mvamor
Reviews.Content: This is a great tourist hotel off the beaten path located near little India. Not comfortable for business travel. Staff friendly. Breakfast was very good. The design of this hotel is boutique chic. Every room has a theme and is different. I stayed in the Jimi Hendrix room so can only review that room. THE BEST BED EVER. Hands down. I didn't want to go to work - just wanted to stay in that bed. However getting in and out of the bed is uncomfortable. Not set up for any working environment. Loved the neon sign. One very important tip - make sure to check the calendar for any Indian holidays, as getting a taxi is very difficult and can take up to half hour. Love the decor downstairs in the lobby area and the group seating in the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of fun, all in a room.”
Reviews.Author: denisenah
Reviews.Content: Booked the whimsical loft room. We got the spaceship themed one. Check-in was at 2pm but were asked to walk around till almost 4pm before we could check in. This was a tad disappointing as the room wasn't cheap and we wanted more time there. In addition, the staff did not offer any late checkout to make up for it. Apart from that, the entire experience was almost magical. Even though we lived in Singapore, it felt like we were transported to another place. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on (pls tell us where we can buy it!). The room was also very well-appointed. The Khiel's products and Nespresso machine were also much appreciated touches to the room. Outside the room, we loved the jacuzzi and the coffee shop. Breakfast left a little more to be desired unfortunately. However, it's understandable since it's a boutique hotel and it doesn't make business sense to cook a full spread for guests everyday. All in all, hope to be back again for another staycation! :D

Reviews.Title: “Fun, designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Williscat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself for 3 days. I booked via their website and requested the "Space" themed room. They emailed me the next day to confirm they would put me in this type of room, which was great. The hotel is very interesting as it is full of designer furniture, like the Eames elephant stools by the pool. I recognised a number of well known designer pieces. The room was a lot of fun. It was painted black and had LED lights in the ceiling and walls, which I kept on at night to give the illusion of sleeping under the stars. There were 3 soft toy aliens in the room and a large spaceship. I felt quite at home... The pool area (small) is nice and the restaurant is very trendy (dinners get booked out, so book in advance). The free breakfast buffet is nice. This hotel is not for everyone. It is very much form over function. The room I stayed in is not designed just to lounge about in (although there is a TV in front of the bed in the loft, which is great). The bed is comfortable, but most of the other furniture isn't. The room is small and may be too small for a couple. Also, there is a shaded glass door for the toilet which is a bit weird when you have guests over. Location is good - a 15 min walk to Orchard Rd, and away from the sterile shopping area. Overall, I loved my time there and will stay again to try out a different kind of room!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it - very quirky!”
Reviews.Author: cathee13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and had a really enjoyable time. The rooms are small so are not ideal if you have a lot of baggage but they are perfectly formed! Each is themed a different colour which them achieve through cool lighting. The bed is super super comfy, the shower is gorgeous and you get posh complementary coffees! There is a lovely chill out area on the roof with a jucuzzi and decking with chilled music playing. The restaurant is lovely and the bar area is great for having a couple of cheeky drinks before hitting the curry houses. Breakfast was really good and the staff were all super friendly. We would recommend this hotel and definately come back in the future

Reviews.Title: “Very quirky but I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller360
Reviews.Content: Make sure you do your research before you book this hotel. Not everyone's gonna like it. But if you know what you can expect and if you are ready for an unusual hotel experience, you gonna enjoy it! The place is crazy with it's unique interior and colors. I loved the details such as the nespresso machine and the Kiehl's amenities. Overall positive: - The location is cool, Little India, full of life and 8 min to the MRT station. - Comfortable bed - Rain shower - Free WifI The noise at night from the street is there, but it wasn't that bad that I couldn't sleep. Honestly, I don't think I would like to stay longer that two nights in this hotel, but it surely was a cool experience I'll remember for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Funky lil hotel with a funky lil smell”
Reviews.Author: mattman808
Reviews.Content: So it sort of pains me to give this hotel such a bad rating because there are so many positives, but there is one issue that cannot be overlooked. This hotel has a serious design flaw. There is not ventilation in the shower which led to excessive mold buildup and resulted in the entire room smelling of mold. If they can address this, the hotel would get a 4 or 5. The hotel is funky, each room is unique and hass great furnishings usually only seen in very high-end hotels such as Phillips iPhone doc, Nespresso machine 8-) and Kheils toiletries. The staff smiles all the time and takes great care of you. The restaraunt is fantastic as well. I must also warn business travelers that there is no desk and the hotel wireless only allows you to connect a single device and it is diffucult if not impossible to switch between. Each time I wanted to switch between my laptop and iPhone I had to contact the front desk to reset the wireless account for my room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: zmrzlina
Reviews.Content: Had a 7 night stay at the Wanderlust while on business in Singapore. My colleague suggested it, and I'm very glad he did. This is an art hotel from top to bottom. All the services are there for business folk, but they've gone to great effort to jazz up the rooms. I stayed on the second floor. The rooms each had a different colour and theme, e.g. Purple Haze, Green is the colour, Yellow submarine. So my room was green and had a green neon sign above the bed and a green lamp. And I liked it. :) The rooms aren't very big but they are certainly suitable for one. The shower and toilet are enclosed in frosted glass partitions rather than as a separate room. If you are with another person it might be awkward to use the loo! The hotel had free wifi but I made the mistake of registering my phone first, after which my laptop wouldn't register (one registration per room). Happily I discovered that you can plug in the cat 5 network cable from the telephone into the network port of your laptop and get internet that way. The beds are mattresses on raised platforms rather than dedicated beds. It sounds weird and looks strange at first glance, but the beds were in fact deliciously comfortable. The only thing I wasn't particularly fond of was the breakfast. The special order items were better than the weak buffet, and the coffee is simply wretched. Finally the location within Little India means that the surroundings are so much more lively and interesting than some other parts of Singapore, and there are some great restaurants nearby. I will be back to Singapore and look to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dont go by the outer looks”
Reviews.Author: SurabhiMehta
Reviews.Content: When I reached the hotel and saw the outside...wasnt very impressive When I enetered inside...it was a completely different world The staff is very helpful Its beautifully designed and well built inside. Every square inch is beautifully designed and well utilized They give you a small notebook with the keycard...loved it the room is not very big but the whole space is wonderfully designed and utilized that you dont mind Its the quality and not the quantity of space My room was all white and had a white light signboard on the wall at the back of the bed that red "My White Noise Blur"...impressive It is close to SimLim and Mustafa

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite boutique hotel in Singapore so far”
Reviews.Author: Pearl-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in 3 hotels in different areas of downtown Singapore, and Wanderlust is our favorite so far. The thoughtful touches of our origami room made our stay a thoroughly enjoyable one. They give a little book with restaurant and shop recommendations, that also includes maps of the surrounding area and other practical information. The LED light show in our room was fun to play with, while the Kiehl's bathroom products were exceptional (as is appropriate to that brand). The hotel is new, so the towels and bedding were also still fluffy and comfortable. We didn't use the jacuzzi area behind the hotel building, but it looked perfect for relaxing with an evening cocktail. The location of the hotel is perfect for meandering around Little India, as well as heading a few blocks to the east into the Arab Street area. (Such great fabric and souvenir shops and fashion boutiques there, as well as mediterranean and arabic restaurants.) We walked with our bags from the MRT stop (we travel light and are used to crowded streets/narrow sidewalks), but others may want to take a cab. The service from the reception desk was impeccable. They offered to show us a few of the fantastically decorated rooms in the hotel before we left for the airport. Glad we did, as the rooms on the upper floors are very large and seem to come from a child's dream -- space rocket, treehouse, etc. Breakfast had a good selection from the simple buffet and tasty pancakes. We didn't eat dinner there, but it was packed. Just 2 complaints -- a lot of water spilled from the shower onto the area under the sink, so it was uncomfortable to stand there. The floor mat was sopping wet. This will also ultimately ruin the wood floors, so hopefully the hotel can make that easy fix. Second, there isn't much storage, so our bags and stuff filled the small entryway.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky with great service”
Reviews.Author: SarahEM66
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our holiday at Wanderlust, someone we met during our travels recommended the hotel. We stayed in the origami room, which was small but had everything we needed and was spotlessly clean. The free mini bar, nespresso machine, free wifi and the lovely Kiehl's toiletries were fantastic. Breakfast was delicious, the buffet was everything we could wish for and the bacon & eggs and the croissants were terrific. The location was really good, only a short walk to the MRT and heaps of places to eat close by. The staff were lovely, friendly and very helpful. We had a wonderful stay at Wanderlust, I'd definitely stay again & I have already recommended this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting”
Reviews.Author: Afield2020
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations, as this hotel seems to be advertised everywhere at the moment, and seemed to be super unique and hip. It is both. I liked the free minibar, the nice products for use in the rooms, and the fact that we had a window. It also had a pretty amazing shower. The lift was fun and had fish at the bottom. The staff were really good and had great uniforms! Not so great aspects - the room would be impossible to air, with no opening windows and being in the centre of the hotel. This means it smells dank, had mould visible in the shower and I have to admit, the smell turned my stomach a little. The room is compact but adequate - the bed is built into a step up floor, and the shower and toilet were in cubicles with a sink in between. It's a good 10 minute walk through the various hindu gods lining the streets in little India to take you to MRT. However, you're close to Sim Lim tower if you want some electronics, and there is a really good, cheap Thai place literally next door. We ate at the in-house French restaurant. I would say the mushroom truffle soup was extraordinary. Everything else expensive/average. I think we got a pretty good deal on our rooms. If you got a good deal and you were relatively young and looking for an experience rather than just a flash and comfy place to stay, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the location”
Reviews.Author: akinsoyleyen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wanderlust Singapore just before i went to KL for 3 nights. The location is in little india so there is always noise outside that bothers you.The walls seems to be thin and you can hear everything outside. Besides that, the hotel is amazing.All the people show you that they are there for you, anytime.Room and hotel design is great.You feel that this is not an ordinary hotel.If you choose the smallest room, it really is small and you might feel a little uncomfortable but when you upgrade to the middle size room, its great 2 - 3 times bigger than the small one and yet more comfortable.I upgraded my room as soon as i enter to the hotel and it was so easy with all the people try to help. The TV in the room is great, Coffee machine , Ipod Dock and the complimentary Minibar is really good.You can find ice cold Cola, Apple juice, orange juice etc... I really would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: Betz_2011
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel in a conservatism shoplot building. Maintained its character while infusing modern touches to the building. I found it to be a very delightful hotel indeed. Stayed one night at one of the mono rooms. Room was not overly spacious but no complains. Room had all the ammenities and more. Loved the nespresso machine, the shower and the comfy king sized bed. The bed and pillows were heavenly. Our room faced the inner courtyard so was not bothered w any noises from outside. Staff were friendly, breakfast was good. The scramled eggs were one of the best ive had in a while. You get a choice of pancakes or big breakfast aka eggs, sausages/bacon,mushroom and tomatoes or breakfast of the day which was frittata on that day. You can also get croissant, danish etc including make your own cereals, muesli. Spread was good enough for the both of us. Location - it was a ten mins walk to bugis mrt station, not too bad. Good that the weather was overcast that weekend. Lots of food places around the hotel so you won't go hungry. Also read that the restaurant, concotte, serves good french food. Wanted to try on sunday but it was closed. Will definitely go back - will try the whimsical rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “my room: a bathroom coridor with a bed at the end”
Reviews.Author: Sergiodubois
Reviews.Content: Imagine a 2 meter wide by 7 meter long room, in blue ceramics, with a cabin for shower an other cabin for toilet and finally a bed. no chair, no table, almost no plug to charge my PC/phone, noisy environment, no chance to stop the air con, and wifi that doesn't work.... well, it is a bit too much for me !!! The decoration is very strange in the hotel. I don't like it, it doens't mean thatis ugly ! Location is OK, in little India, 10min walk from the MRT. 200 meters from Sim lim square if you want to buy electronics. Service is Ok, breackfast is average (poor buffet, but they serve eggs.

Reviews.Title: “T'was alright.”
Reviews.Author: bizarrebeings
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in the Black Pantone room - Fade To Black. I understand it's a conservation building and a boutique hotel, but still the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, and for that price too! Loved the decor of the room though, and was very pleased with the Kiehl's products given for the shower. The rain shower was perfect for a nice relaxing bath. The iPod dock was also a plus ... Not to mention that the few drinks in the fridge were complimentary, that was very convenient! Having free wifi available was a bonus too. Just outside of our room, there was the hotel's tiny jacuzzi which we didn't make time to us. However, a certain kerosene-like smell will be emitted from the shower area after use, probably the sewage. Also, the flush was too weak, we had to always press and hold for many seconds before it 'worked its wonder'. Pillows were a tad too soft, gave us stiff necks and shoulders after. And then, the noise. Could barely sleep through as the doors outside kept slamming shut. That noise was just way too loud, not a good point. Breakfast was not a big deal, included in the price - that's what you get. It's just ideal for a night getaway I suppose, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: shutt3rbug
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a smaller level 2 room, the yellow submarine but as I had to do some video conferencing with clients in NZ it was really too small. Staff were excellent, they promptly upgraded us to the 3rd level Mono rooms with more space which was perfect for our needs. We stayed for 7 nights and never felt boxed in. Internet was sufficient for multi point VC. Breakfasts were included in the rate and were good quality. For being in such a manic place as Little India you would think it would be noisy but we found it surprisingly quiet and loved the enormous bed in the room. Staff were attentive, friendly and very helpful - would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with superior service”
Reviews.Author: spinnars
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not only offer you a cool design experience but also truly good service and fingertip feeling! The place has all the details that you want to have and want to pay for but none of the details that you wonder why they are there! Assumably my best hotel stay ever!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and offbeat. My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JuneB_Escalante
Reviews.Content: After several weeks of hotel travel, the rooms all look the same -- unless you're at the Wanderlust! In February, I was in a grey space capsule room. Now in March, I'm in a origami room with bending walls and colored recessed lighting that you can control. The enormous shower room has a huge rainwater disk and genuinely hot water that lasts for the entire shower. I agree that there's very little work space and even fewer electrical outlets, but I just set up shop on the fabulous bed with the four-foot-long pillow and worked away, stopping only for lunch at one of the many authentic food stalls in vibrant Little India. I'm coming back in April.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic except for the thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ED1NT
Reviews.Content: We loved Wanderlust in general - especially all the small things that have been mentioned before - coffee machine, free mini bar, funky room, guide book, friendly helpful staff etc. My only negative comment has also been mentioned before - noise. We could hear the people at the restaurant outside our window all day and all night (I wasn't well and up a lot during the night) despite there being two windows (the old original ones on the outside and newer ones on the inside) this wouldn't normally bother me too much but because i was sick it was very irritating. On the whole though, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and innovative”
Reviews.Author: MrWayn0
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel right from the first moment I arrived. I'd endured a 24 hour delay in Paris before I got to Singapore so hadn't exactly got off to a great start. But I was pleasantly surprised with everything about this small boutique hotel. The staff are friendly, the decor is quirky and the little touches like the Kiehls products in the bathroom and the funky coffee machine in the living area add that little bit of magic just when you need it. I was also upgraded to a loft room which had a bed on the mezzanine. Very clever use of space! Food is great - a little expensive in the restaurant - but the breakfast is good. I'd definitely stay again - maybe for a little longer than one night next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and stylish, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: eicara
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Wanderlust a lot, Little India is one of the nicest quarters in town, the hotel as a whole and rooms are very stylish, although rooms are rather small, they are very well equipped (Nespresso coffee, Kiehl's products etc). Breakfast is ok, although do not expect too much, rather American style. In total, a very nice choice, the hotel is fun!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, vibrant and cool”
Reviews.Author: poptartlr
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights in Singapore - this was our first time in Singapore, and we couldn't have picked a better place. We picked the loft bedroom (we had the funky typewriter themed room), and it was amazing - new york style loft, with the comfiest and plushest bed I have ever stayed in. Two flat screens up stairs and down stairs, pod coffeemaker and ipod dock, free minibar, keihls toiletries, wonderfully fluffy robes, free internet....it was great. The staff were very helpful too, they always greeted us with a smile whenever we went through the lobby. The decor is just amazing - love the fishpond at the base of the lift shaft and the vibrant lobby area. The location is perfect too - Little India is my favourite part of SIngapore - still vibrant, and the food is well worth it. We went from here to a 5 star hotel for NYE - what a bad choice! In comparison the 5 star hotel was very bland, expensive internet and dated decor.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kuen74
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 29 Nov to 05 Dec, and must say that for the hotels that I have stayed in thus far, given the price for that particular period in Singapore, it seemed reasonable. I booked a pantone room for approx. 180SGD for my whole duration, and was pleasantly surprise to be upgraded to a loft room on the 4th floor for my whole stay. Not your typical hotel, but more a ‘design boutique’ hotel that teeters more towards the quirky rather than the luxe. That being said, with Kiehl toiletries, Samsung flat screen TVs, complimentary mini-fridge of juice (apple and orange), Coke (both regular and Zero), and 2 daily bottled water; and to me a super comfy bed to boot. I can’t ask for more, as I always feel that the quality of a hotel can be seen from the selection of their pillows and mattresses. I do hope that the management do not change these provisions in the near future as to have a Coke in hand after a hot day is a welcome. That said, supper down at the two coffee shop a stone throw away is just easy to tackle I would have to say that this hotel is gear towards adventurous couples looking to spend some romantic time away, but to be rather objective will list down the pros and cons of the place. But on a personal level, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Wanderlust Lust. I always like to start with the bad stuff: 1.Was slightly noisy during the day, as it seems that there was some drilling work nearly going on. But it was not such a disruptive decibel that you cannot fall asleep. But just to note for people who may be noise sensitive (but to begin with, if you don’t like the hussle and bussle of little Indian you shouldn’t be staying there). 2.Thin walls along the corridor. You can sometime hear people talking… but that doesn’t not happen regularly. 3.Variety of breakfast spread is limited though it is a buffet The good stuff: 1.Complimentary room upgrade! 2.Complimentary mini fridge with water, softdrinks and juices restocked daily (not too sure if this came with the room upgrade…) 3.Free internet wifi access 4.Complimentary daily news papers 5.Free toiletries and lotion from Kiehl 6. Nespresso coffee in the room 7.Daily breakfast though is limited, but it is quality and not quantity that counts; and this does have the quanlity. And to add, I loved the little notebook they gave highlighting the little gems around the vicinity of little India. Quirky!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel with a Unique Touch”
Reviews.Author: getlucky
Reviews.Content: OK the room (pantone) is small but it is enough for two imo. The service staff were excellent and helpful with everything that we asked/needed (except for the night shift security who stared at us like we were thieves). Complimentary drinks and amenities are top quality (can't compliment the hotel enough, keep it up!) I'm surprised by the thick and soft towels that they gave us (even better than some 5 star hotels!!) Free wifi is always a plus. On one of the nights, the noise from the back alley restaurant got pretty loud but the rest of the days that we stayed there, it was normal. All in all a pleasant stay in this chic boutique hotel. BTW if the manager of the hotel is still active on this site, feel free to contact me through PM or email as I have a few minor ideas/tweaks on how to improve the rooms which would not cost a lot. I myself am developing a boutique hotel in Bali and would like an exchange of ideas and add my network of like minded business people.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun place to stay for short break”
Reviews.Author: biptutti
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Black Pantone room and loved it, am surprised by the recent comments about noise as we experienced none and our room was next to the garden which backs onto the lane way restaurant. The thought that has gone into the detail was great: coffee machine in reach of bed!, Kiehl bath products, free newspaper, soft drink and juices. The staff were very helpful as well and was the best breakfast we had on our trip in Asia, well the closest to western style anyway. Note, I don't think it would be comfortable for a long stay, as the rooms are small and their is a lack of storage space for luggage. I think the glass (semi-frosted where it counts) shower and toilet would challenge some people as well as the floor level bed. The only negative, is it is not particularly close to the metro. It's a good 15min walk to either Bugis or Little India, which is fine unless it's bucketing down. It is Singapore after all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, but with serious noise issues and little peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: janu007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend on the 2nd floor (Pantone rooms). The design of the rooms is nice, each room in a different color. We had a red room which was nice to look at but hard on the eyes after a while. The toilet and shower are not in a separate room, but are in glass enclosed stalls within the one main room, which I didn't like. The room has nice features like a nespresso maker, ipod dock and free drinks (non-alco) in the minibar. There is a jacuzzi for the hotel guests to use but when we arrived in was under maintenance and then after that was finished, it was just cold, so that was disappointing. The reason why we wouldn't come back to this hotel is because of the noise issues. I'm not sure if any thought was given to soundproofing and you can hear everything going on in the room next to you, below and above you. The majority of the rooms on the 2nd floor (the colored rooms), are only 1 floor above an alleyway which is occupied by a popular Thai restaurant, it is really really noisy and we had trouble sleeping as the noise went on til about 1 o'clock. We asked to move to a second room which was less noisy. It wasn't at all less noisy, there was still the noise from the alleyway adn to make matters worse, there were renovations going on in the room above us and we had to put up with drilling and sanding noises for a couple of hours, until we called the front desk and asked that it stop. The restaurant that is in the lobby also starts playing music at about 8am, and this woke us up as well. Had I known about the construction going on here, and the noise coming from both restaurants, I wouldn't have booked here. The rooms are nice, but we wanted somewhere quieter to stay so I can't recommend this hotel to others (maybe if you stay in a more expensive room on a higher floor it might be better, but actually there are only 4 floors so it is likely you'd still hear the noise)

Reviews.Title: “A fun and funky little hotel well worth a try for those looking for fun leisure hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice and enjoyed excellent service, the property is a new boutique hotel in Little India with easy proximity to the excellent Arab Street area, and Colonial Area. Both times we stayed in the entry level rooms on L2 – the individually coloured ones, two nights in the Black one (Metallica – Fade to Black) and one in the Red (U2 - Red Light) we are fans of both groups! The colour scheme works best as the black, as practically everything is black. The innovative layout is not for the conservative traveller, we wanted to stay somewhere new and interesting, and it worked for us very well. The rooms are compact, which is fine for most, it was for us, so don’t expect to be able to host a party. Cocette is a great restaurant downstairs on L1, we thoroughly enjoyed lingering over our breakfasts before stepping out into the hustle and bustle of Little India. There is no desk or seating in the L2 rooms, however the towels are massive and shower is great with free water, juice and soft drinks in the fridge and WiFi included, really nice shampoos and soaps etc. The bed is sunken into an elevated section of the floor, so it perhaps suits the nimble. The lighting is intelligent with night lighting and two lamps, the rooms also well appointed with a clock radio that accepts iPods. A great little coffee maker for coffee drinkers like myself who like real coffee. We would definitely recommend this property to like minded travellers who want a fun and funky place to stay, the only warning is that the locals on the Thursday night were up for some fun and appeared to go all night out on the street, although we did not find that to be the case on the Friday or Saturday nights. It was a great base to explore Singapore and of course to local shopping and Indian food was exceptional both in quality and value. The general fitout is quite remarkable and the lift shaft is adjacent to an atrium garden which looks amazing as you travel in the glass sided lift. We would have loved to stay on L4 in the loft rooms, however our budget did not extend to it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap design, Small room and Low value hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaBeijing
Reviews.Content: My classmate in singapore recommended me this hotel and labled it as "design hotle". I booked Pantone room first. With my classmate's special rate. It's SGD 170. It's the smallest room I've ever seen. I changed to Mono Room at SGD240. Still it's very small. Low-taste design, cheap material. All in all, I won't stay any more.

Reviews.Title: “At its quirky best!”
Reviews.Author: Chets11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my first trip to Singapore for a conference & was quite taken aback at the quirkiness of the hotel -- which I loved, might I add. It's a small yet charming hotel with comfortable rooms and a great staff! Rooms are of decent size and feature color changing ceiling lights, coffee machine, LCD television, iPod dock+clock, telephone. The bathroom features a rainfall shower along with toiletries, vanity kits, wardrobe has bathrobes, hair-dryer and a shoe-shiner. Our room's minibar was stocked with packed juice and few diet colas - inclusive of the tariff. It's got a standard daily breakfast menu - omelets, bagel, tea/coffee, juice, variety of breads, etc. and I didn't get around trying other meals. The hotel also has its own jacuzzi (NOT a swimming pool) on the second level -- didn't get to try it so can't talk much about it. They don't have a business center, but the staff at the reception will give you print outs (if there aren't much) at no cost. The hotel has free WiFi. However, in twin sharing bedrooms only ONE person/device can access the WiFi at a time. Located closer to Little India on the Upper Dickson Road, we had quite few problems getting a cab. While you could request the hotel to call for one, some times you just want to step out immediately and halt a cab. The Suntec Convention Center is about 10 minutes away (so is every thing else in Singapore), and costed us around S$ 7-8, Clarke Quay would be around S$ 9-11 at nights.

HotelInfo.Name: Wanderlust
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Dickson Road, Singapore 209494, Singapore
